This document complies with the rules for the structure and drafting of standard files as specified in GB1.1 Part 3 of the Standardization Work Guide issued by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology.

This file replaces GB 18030 1-2005 "Chinese Encoding Character Set for Information Technology" with GB 18030 1-2005, apart from structural adjustments and editorial modifications, the main differences are as follows:
The scope of application of these rules (Chapter I) has been expanded (see Chapter I for the objects to which these rules apply).

In the double byte encoding region, the positions of 10 vertical punctuation marks and 8 Chinese component codes in GB13000 were changed. Besides, 6 Chinese components with repeated codings and 9 Chinese characters with repeated codings (as listed in Appendix D of the 2005 version of Appendix A) were excluded.
In the four-byte encoding area, 18 positions of GB13000 codes were changed (see Appendix D of the 2005 version of Appendix D).
Deleted "Appendix A" for "Additional Chinese Characters and Radicals/Components" from the 2005 version.
Added support for implementation levels (see para. 9).
Added informative appendix "Common Standard Chinese Characters Table and Code Positions of Ideographic Characters" in Appendix P.

A total of 51.7 million new non-farm jobs were added, significantly higher than the market's expected 18.9 million; the unemployment rate dropped to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; hourly wages increased by 4.4% compared to the previous year

In terms of the total, this data contains many one-time and technical factors that affect fluctuations, such as the return to work of striking teachers, the adjustment of survey statistical methods, and the update of seasonal factors. Subsequent revisions are possible (referring to the revision of non-agricultural employment in January 2022 from 504,000 people to 364,000 people). Non-agricultural

Structurally, high tech companies' layoffs still have an impact but to a lesser extent; high-touch service industries such as leisure hotels, education, and healthcare have significantly increased new hires, data shows that the labor shortage in the service industry still exists.

With the unexpected surge in service industry PMI, job openings, and labor shortages data, as well as the robust strength of consumption credit data, we conclude that the US service industry has undergone rapid recovery after going through extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the labor market in the United States, without going through a recession, finds it difficult to alleviate the supply and demand tension.

Currently, the U.S. labor market has over 500,000 supply gaps, while the labor force participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor force participation rate of those aged 25-54, which is close to its pre-pandemic high.
Besides this, due to the strong savings and consumer credit of American residents, the impact of monetary policy on the labor market will be further delayed due to the robust demand.
The labor market in the United States remains tight, suggesting that supply and demand will remain tight and be a key feature of the US economy in 2023.
With interest rate hikes nearing an end and inflation expectations fluctuating, we are not pleased with the persistent decline in wage growth.
Before the data release, the U.S. financial market's expectations for the Federal Reserve's interest rate hike path were overly optimistic.

With the continuous improvement of inflation data, the Federal Reserve is maintaining the fragile balance of market inflation expectations while tightening at a slower pace. However, the market's bias towards the "hawkish" stance of the Federal Reserve is overlooked, as not only is there a prediction of an early halt to raising interest rates, but there is also a forecast for two rate cuts by year-end.

In a labor market with tight supply and demand, where the impact of monetary policy is unclear, we believe the Federal Reserve's guidance for a rate hike at year-end is relatively reasonable. The market's extreme adjustments and trading congestion due to excessive expectations could cause harm to the market.

Despite the persistent stubbornness of wage growth in the face of rapidly declining inflation, with M2 data turning negative and various CPI component leading indicators gradually improving, the U.S. CPI data has been in a rapid decline phase since October. The stubborn wage growth will only serve as a baseline for future inflation data, and the current market expectations are hard to refute. After the next period of inflation data is released, the market may enter a new round of bargaining

"The Securities and Futures Commission authorizes the development of "Fund Accounts": Investors can consolidate and inquire about all their funds under their name - Economic Observer - Professional Financial News Website"
Economic Observer Reporter Chen Jade: Is the complex channel for fund purchases making it difficult to collect account information?
Do people always forget about "the little treasure chest"? (Note: "小金庫" is a translation of "杉杉", which is mentioned in the context as a company name.)
These problems of the common people will be solved soon.
On February 10, the Securities and Exchange Commission announced that the "Fund E Account" App is available and in public beta testing on various mobile application stores.

According to the introduction, "基金E賬戶" provides a "one-stop" inquiry service for investors' public fund account and share information for retail investors, aiming to address the pain points of forgetting accounts and complicated queries in the industry.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 public fund management companies in China with a total fund size of approximately 260 billion yuan; the registration institutions for public fund units numbered 167, and there were 411 sales institutions for public funds.
Each registration institution's account system is mutually independent, lacking a unified industry query channel.
Industry insiders state that there were over 7.2 million investment investors in our country at the end of 2021, meaning that half of the population had invested in fund products.

Before, investors had to inquire about their purchase situations through different sales channels. However, through "基金E賬戶," they can check their purchase situations in all sales channels, making their holdings in funds clear at a glance.
What is the "基金E賬戶" App?

According to relevant documents, "基金E賬戶" App is a settlement account developed and constructed with the approval of the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC) for the securities industry gateway on mobile phones, providing investors with a one-stop query for holding situations of public fund products outside the register.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp their holdings of public fund products issued by various fund management companies under different sales channels through "基金E賬戶," significantly enhancing query efficiency.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through "基金E賬戶" includes: the account information of funds opened with various fund management companies in the market, the account information of trading accounts opened with fund sales outlets, and the holding situation of products such as publicly offered investment funds and asset management plans managed by securities companies, which do not have a limit of 200 investors.

The business responsible person of the Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, Liu Yiqian, told Economic Observer's reporter that investors can obtain information about all their holdings of outside mutual funds through the "基金E賬戶" App in one place, helping them recover "The Forgotten Assets." More importantly, it helps clients collect comprehensive information on their consolidated fund investment situations, enabling them to more timely, accurately, and completely manage

Investors can contact the fund management company they hold the fund with to obtain it.

"A representative from a large securities fund in Shanghai gave a six-digit invitation code to an Economist Watch reporter and said, 'During the trial operation of the APP, a certain number of invitation codes are provided by ChinaNet Settlement to each fund management company. Investors can obtain it by calling. We will all provide it.' "
After the trial operation ends, there will be no need for invitation codes for user registration.

The business responsible person of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, Liu Yiqian, told Economic Observer's reporter that investors can obtain information about all their off-exchange mutual funds through the "Fund E Account" App, helping them recover "forgotten assets." More importantly, it collects comprehensive investment information of the entire account for customers, allowing them to better grasp their investment situation in a timely, accurate, and complete manner, and optimize

Journalist completed the account registration and query process for "Fund E Account" within a few minutes by following the download and usage instructions published on the China Securities Regulatory Commission website. The entire process can be divided into four steps: user registration, real name authentication, binding of fund account, and query of public fund.

After completing the real name authentication, click the "Asset" button for the "Fund Binding" feature. The reporter can see all the mutual fund products purchased through various mutual fund sales platforms in the binding option list (available accounts). After completing the binding, the total asset value of the invested funds can be directly viewed, and the query function can be used.
Noted is that "基金E賬戶" only provides query services for investors and cannot process redemption or purchase transactions.
The date displayed in the "Fund E Account" generally represents the date three trading days prior to the user's query (T-3 day).
For example, opening the "基金E賬戶" on February 10th, the total assets, shares, and net asset value displayed on the assets page correspond to the dates three trading days before, which is February 7th.

The United States, Japan, and the Philippines reach a security pact against China.
In Asia, on February 9th, Philippine President Bongbong Marcos visited Japan and held talks with Prime Minister Kishida Fumio.

The two parties agreed to oppose China's infringement on the South China Sea and East China Sea and issued a joint statement after the meeting, stating that they will sign a trilateral defense agreement with the United States and conduct substantial military exchanges to counter China's hegemonic policies.
According to Japanese media reports, Kishida hopes that this meeting will help Japan and the Philippines establish a policy to address the Taiwan Strait crisis.
Bongbong Marcos visited China at the beginning of this year and secured a deal valued at over $200 million.
Since then, China-Philippines relations have not only failed to improve, but have worsened instead.
Early this month, the Philippines signed a pact with the US, agreeing to open more bases for the American military, ensuring security in the South China Sea.
A new base added is 300 kilometers away from Taiwan, making it the closest point to China.
If Taiwan faces a crisis, the US military may take action from Philippine bases.

Japanese media believe that Japan, South Korea, Australia, and even the Philippines are now forming the core with the United States, building the "counter China arc" in the Western Pacific, to promote cooperation in the region.

Vice Chairman of the Nationalist Party, Andrew Hsia, visited China and conveyed the message of James Soong regarding the 1992 Consensus: it is welcome to visit the mainland with a green (pro-democracy) stance.

Taiwan Vice Chairperson of the Kuomintang Andrew Hsia visited Chinese Taipei Representative Song Tong and Chinese Communist Party Central Committee Politburo Standing Committee Member and Secretary of the Central Secretariat Wang Huning in China.

The Nationalist Party's think tank, the National Policy Foundation, senior consultant Chao Chun-shan was interviewed by Taiwan Central News Agency last night. He expressed positive views on Song Tong's remarks by Nationalist Party Vice Chairman Hsia Li-jen, that as long as they acknowledge the "1992 Consensus" and oppose Taiwan independence, China welcomes green camp visitors to the mainland.
The Nationalist Party views it as something new.
Summery Li met Song Tong before the news reported this. (This statement was not mentioned in the news about Summery Li's meeting with Song Tong earlier.)
The ruling Democratic Progressive Party in Taiwan has been clarifying for several days that they refuse to accept the "1992 Consensus."

According to Central News Agency today, Taiwan's Nationalist Party Vice Chairman Xia Liogen led a delegation to visit the mainland and during his stay in Beijing, he separately met with member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and Secretary of the Central Secretariat Wang Huning, new head of the Taiwan Affairs Office Song Tong and Beijing Municipal Committee Secretary Yin Li.

Summertime (Xia Li-men) and Tsong Tong-zung (Song Thong) discussed the political foundation of the KMT-CCP relationship being the "92 Consensus" and opposition to Taiwan independence during their meeting. Zhao Chun-shan, a senior consultant at the KMT's National Policy Foundation, expressed during the meeting that the KMT's "92 Consensus" remains the authentic "92 Consensus."
Chao Chun-shan analyzed that this was different from the past few meetings he had attended.

In recent times, during video conferences with scholars from the mainland, and this particular conference, no mention of unification or the "Anti-Split Law" was heard. Instead, there was a focus on restoring interactions and dialogue.

Chao Chun-shan pointed out that the military tensions between the two sides are dangerous, and the mainland China hopes to convey its intentions to improve relations through the Nationalist Party (KMT).

Due to the lack of mutual trust between the KMT and the CCP, the latter still intends to work for the benefit of Taiwanese people, indicating that they do not wish to see the relations between the two sides deteriorate.

According to Chao Chun-shan, Wang Huning also personally issued instructions to Song Tong that "they (Taiwan farmers and fishermen) have put forth their demands, which must be implemented"; if it couldn't be resolved through negotiations, a legal action would be taken.

The report does not mention if Nationalist Party members have directly brought up the issue of daily harassment of Taiwan by Chinese military aircraft and naval vessels, or the agricultural issues in Taiwan's less populated areas, during their visits to the mainland, or if Central News Agency reporters have asked such questions during their interviews.
The Labor Union holds another large-scale protest against the government's pension reform plan.

On Saturday, the 11th of February, the French Labor Union once again mobilized nationwide against the government's pension reform bill, urging the public to take to the streets and express their opinions.
This is the fourth "D Day" of social movements opposing the government's pension reform bill.
The number of people who respond to the rally's call may influence the next course of action for the labor union.

This is the fourth time that the eight major labor union groups in France have jointly mobilized nationwide within a month, and it is the first time that this protest has been scheduled for a Saturday.

Given that for most French people, Saturday is a day off, they don't have to choose between participating in a demonstration or going on strike to express their opinions, the labor union hopes that today's rally will attract more people to participate.

The workers' unions of the subway system and public railway companies have not called for strikes today. The subway system should be able to operate normally, allowing citizens to travel to the rally venue by taking public transportation. In areas where schools have started winter break, people can proceed with their vacation plans as usual.

The labor unions hope that over one hundred million people will attend today's rally, while the police estimate the total number of attendees in the country may be between 60 million and 80 million, with around 9 million to 12 million gathering in the Paris region.

Since the anti-government pension reform protest began, although surveys show that most French people do not support raising the legal retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people actually taking to the streets to join the marches has gradually decreased.
"On January 31st, the first strike and protest rally gathered 127 million to 250 million people across the country."
The demonstration crowd this week (February 7) has shrunk to between 75 million 7 thousand and 200 million people nationwide.
This pension reform plan is currently under deliberation in the French National Assembly.
The opposition party, particularly those with radical left-wing leaders, have submitted countless amendment proposals, resulting in a very slow legislative process.
And the debates between government and opposition also become increasingly sharp and heated.

An radical left-wing political party's French member recently posted a picture of a balloon with the image of the Labour Minister's face on it on social media, which drew opposition from the ruling party.
The National Assembly chairman ultimately declared a 15-day ban on this legislator's participation in parliamentary activities as a punishment for such behavior.

Despite this reform plan causing the largest social trends in France over the past 20 years, the government has only made slight adjustments to the bill so far, but has not made any major concessions.

The union is preparing to launch another protest on next week's Thursday, that is, the 16th, and on March 7th, when the reform bill was submitted for discussion in the Senate, the union also planned to organize a demonstration.
China encourages raising the birth rate and donating semen of high quality in schools.

China's Yunnan Province Human Sperm Bank issued an advertisement on the 9th, soliciting donors with a bachelor's degree or above or current students to donate sperm. Those who donated 8 to 12 times successfully received a RMB 4500 subsidy.
According to Taiwan media reports today, the message went viral on Weibo and sparked follow-up actions in Zhejiang, Shaanxi, Hubei, Shandong, and Beijing, among other provinces and cities.
According to a report signed by Liberty Times, China encourages university students to donate sperm.

The threshold for donating sperm in Beijing universities is the highest among all cities. Besides having a good educational background, one must be at least 170 cm tall, have perfectly formed features, and have no noticeable baldness or a refractive error worse than 600 degrees.

According to the report, Yunnan Provincial Human Sperm Bank stated that sperm donors can receive a comprehensive male health check worth 1000 renminbi, including "particularly semen and chromosome tests, which most people have never undergone before, and is significant in understanding one's reproductive status."
The conditions for donating sperm include being at least 165cm tall, holding a college degree or above, and having no color blindness or carriers of B hepatitis or infectious diseases.

The report cites China Tianmu Xinwen News that the Shaanxi Provincial Human Semen Library has a promotional poster that reads "Paid Sperm Donation, Everlasting Glory." It calls on young folks to respond to sperm donation and encourages netizens to forward related information, "Let love spread."
In Shaanxi Province, the price is higher than in Yunnan. Qualified donors can receive RMB 300 in cash per time, and those who complete a certain number of donations can receive RMB 5000 as a subsidy.
Currently, the highest known fee is in Beijing, with a maximum subsidy of 5150 renminbi.

On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall, which had separated East and West Berlin for 28 years, was opened, Modrow stated that he would help transform East Germany into a democratic country.
At that time, due to protests for democracy and liberty in various parts of East Germany, the Communist Party leaders were forced to resign.
Mikhail Gorbachev, as the leader of the Soviet Union, also called for reforms in its Eastern European territories.
In March 1990, Mikhail Gorbachev announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results caused him to no longer serve as prime minister.
Despite Gorbachev's reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and unification scheduled for October 1990.
He is still criticized for trying to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Mohamed El-Baradei was indicted for electoral fraud during the municipal elections in May 1989, but he was not imprisoned.
Some have claimed that the charges were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German Parliament, and from 1999 to 2004, he served as a Member of the European Parliament.
"Mohdero considers himself a reformer within the Communist Party."
In 1999, he told Reuters that he didn't want the old East to return, but acknowledged the achievements of East Germany.
Mohderoe was born in Jasenitz, a German village, in 1928, and received mechanic training.

During World War II, he served as a leader in the youth firehouse, and later became a member of the Nazi volunteer militia organization Volkssturm, which conscripted men aged 16 to 60 to participate in the last war efforts.
At the age of 17, Mohder was captured by the Soviet military and taken to the Soviet Union as a prisoner of war. There, he attended anti-fascist programs and became a firm Communist Party member.
In 1949, the year East Germany was established, he returned to the country and found a job as a mechanic, continuing to study social sciences and economics and eventually earning a doctorate.

Moddero was a worker in the Free German Youth Movement, almost all young folks in East Germany joined this movement, and he rose to the chairmanship of the Party of the Socialist Unity of Germany (SED) in the Dresden region during the period of its rule from 1973 to 1989.
He still served in the East German parliament for over 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, assuming the highest national offices.

The speech of the president was interrupted on the live broadcast on the Internet for approximately one minute. The screen displayed the symbols of a group of Iranian anti-government hackers named "Edalat Ali (Ali Justice)."

Does the balloon event make America's eyes shine even brighter?
Strengthening the restriction of technology exports to China.
According to a report in The Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten its export controls on Chinese tech following the balloon incident.

Current and former security officials have stated that the above balloon event highlights the national security threat posed by China and will seek greater political endorsement for strengthening US technology protection.
The United States stated that the balloon carried sensors and communications antennas for intelligence gathering.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior official at the US Central Intelligence Agency now serving at the Washington, D.C.-based think tank Center for a New American Security, said...
"This undoubtedly added fuel to the hardline stance towards China."

White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre stated on Thursday, "We will also consider taking larger actions to expose and counter China's larger-scale surveillance activities. These activities pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners."
U.S. officials have reported the situation of the above balloon incident to over 30 governments. International coordination is crucial in addressing the Chinese threat.

Senior research fellow Emily Benso at the Strategy and International Studies Research Center of the American think tank stated that besides the actions of the Biden administration, the newly established US-China Communist Party Strategy Competition Committee in the US House of Representatives could also pressure the US to adopt more stringent measures to hinder China's development.
She said, Congressmen will feel increasing pressure to take a stronger stance, which in turn may force the White House to adopt more hardline policies.
The Wall Street Journal reports that many advocates for stricter export control are also pushing for an expansion of the control scope, including industries such as artificial intelligence.
The U.S. government is also formulating a review plan for foreign investment, examining whether American investments overseas pose potential national security threats from China.
Analysts say, the White House may face calls to accelerate the implementation of the program.
The "921 Earthquake" Relief and Recovery Programme's work never ends (lit. dusk till dawn).

Since the strong earthquake between Turkey and Syria, rescue teams from over fifty countries have been working tirelessly day and night in the thousands of ruined buildings caused by the earthquake, digging out survivors buried under the rubble.
In the cold temperature, they often call for quietness, as they strain to hear any signs of life from the ruins of the concrete pile.
According to Reuters, two women were rescued from the rubble of an earthquake debris after surviving for several days.
The death toll from the earthquake has risen to 24,150 people.
The number of deaths in Turkey is 20,665, and over 3,500 people have died in Syria.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that occurred on a Monday has continued to generate several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, making it the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the casualties of the 2011 Japanese earthquake and tsunami, and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by the neighboring Iranian earthquake in 2003.
In August 17, 1999, a similar strong earthquake occurred in northwestern Turkey, causing over 17,000 deaths.

Turkish authorities announced on Saturday that two women were rescued by relief workers from the rubble of a collapsed building in the region after the deadliest earthquake in Turkey in the past 20 years, which left them trapped for 122 hours.
A 55-year-old man named Masallah Cicek, who was injured, was rescued from the ruins of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In the cold temperature, rescue workers often call for calmness, as they strive to listen for any signs of life from the rubble of the concrete debris.

In Samandag district of Turkey, rescue teams are squatting under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" --- "God willing" --- as they carefully extend their hands into the rubble to rescue a 10-day-old neonate.
He opened his wide eyes, baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a heating blanket and carried to the combat hospital.
The video image shows that rescue workers also took away his mother, who was woozy and dizzy with her head hanging low and pale-faced, but mentally alert.

Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay informed the media in the late night that within the past 24 hours, 67 people were rescued from the ruins, and 31,000 rescue personnel were deployed in the affected area.
He said, approximately 80,000 people are being treated in the hospital, while over 105 million people are left homeless due to the earthquake and are crowded in temporary shelters.
Due to many people lacking food in the harsh winter conditions, the public's questions towards the leaders of the two countries regarding their disaster relief responses are becoming more frequent.

According to Syrian official media, President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, along with his wife Asma, visited a hospital in Aleppo. Reports indicate that this was his first visit to the disaster area since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme stated that due to the complexities of relief work caused by the state of war, its stocks in the northwestern Syria controlled by rebels were about to run out.
On Friday, Erdogan visited Adıyaman Province in Turkey, admitting that the government's response did not meet the expected speed.
Opponents seized on this issue to attack Erdoğan, who was set to run for re-election on May 14th, but it might be delayed due to the disaster.
Reuters reported, the anger over the delayed relief and initiation of rescue work may influence the election.
Even before the earthquake, the election was seen as the most serious challenge for Erdoğan's rule in the past twenty years.
Erdogan urged the members of the Council to unite and condemned the "apathetic actions driven by political interests" as he called them.
The main opposition party leader of Turkey, Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, criticizes the government's response.
Criticized as, "The earthquake is large, but more serious is the lack of coordination, lack of planning, and inability."

Reuters stated that the anger over delayed aid and the initiation of rescue work could influence the election. The situation was already considered the most severe challenge to Erdogan's rule in Erdolan for the past twenty years, even before the earthquake occurred. What is the "object" that was shot down in the sky over Alaska?
Perplexed and baffled, guesses abound.
An F-22 Raptor, the United States military's most advanced stealth fighter jet, crashed into an unidentified object in the sky over Alaska on a Thursday afternoon (February 10th).
The location of the object that was shot down is ten miles from the Alaska coast.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has intercepted an airborne object in the sky.
Last Saturday, a spy balloon from China floated in the US sky for several days before being destroyed near the coast of South Carolina, USA.

The Pentagon stated that the second object entered US airspace for the first time on Wednesday night in the northeastern part of Alaska, was tracked in the air by the US military, and had a flying altitude of 120,000 meters (400,000 feet). Its size was roughly similar to that of a small car, but much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon intercepted previously.
The Pentagon still believes, based on current evidence, that this object is not controllable.

John Copp, the National Security Council communications and liaison officer at the White House, stated on Thursday that while the exact nature of this object flying in the sky is unclear, it "poses a reasonable threat to civil aviation."
Copper stated that this object was different from the espionage balloon found within the US borders, as it had no payload suspended above it.
Copper said, "We call it 'an object' as the best description we can make at the moment."
Biden President listened to the Pentagon's recommendation before ordering to shoot down the object. He made this decision being "very cautious," Cobbs added.

The description of this object by US officials can be roughly summarized as: Its size is approximately that of a small car, it has no control sticks, no suspension system, and flies at an altitude of around 10,000 meters.
These pieces of information cannot answer basic questions such as what this object is, which country it belongs to, and what task it is performing.
Currently, there are many analyses and speculations online that suggest, this could be another Chinese balloon.
It might be similar to the espionage balloon intruding American airspace from China, or the Chinese balloon drifting in the skies of Latin America.
Some people link the "object" in Alaska to a "UFO" (Unidentified Flying Object).
Peter Meijer, a former U.S. congressman, tweeted on a Thursday that he hoped the "unidentified flying object" in the news was an "espionage balloon" rather than a legitimate UFO.
"Peter Meijer remarked, 'It's quite surprising to joke about mixing extraterrestrial spaceships with weather balloons, but it's not worth causing an interstellar conflict over it.'"
Meijer made this tweet not long after the object in Alaska was reportedly hit.
The News Journal reported that there are doubts this object is a UFO, not just from Peter Meijer, but from others as well.

Tennessee Republican Congressman Tim Burchett criticized the government's handling of concealed information last month and called on the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to disclose reports regarding "unidentified flying objects" (UFOs).
